p: The sequence percentage identity of the SARS-CoV-2 M pro to SARS-CoV M pro and MERS-CoV M pro was determined using a standard protein Basic Local Alignment Search (BLASTp) tool ( https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Blast.cgi?PAGE=Proteins). Multiple sequence alignment of the three sequences were performed using CLUSTAL W algorithm [ 26]. Pairwise structural clustering of SARS-CoV-2 M pro, SARS-CoV M pro and MERS-CoV M pro was analyzed using UCSF Chimera tool [ 27].
